intro: Diodonta aristosa, commonly known as the hairy bladder nut, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy, spiky fruits that resemble small bladder-like structures. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions.
